cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 205 miles ESE of Wilmington, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: continuing northwest toward the North Carolina/South Carolina coast, then forecast to slow and drift west-southwest over South Carolina and toward the southern Appalachians
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the southern North Carolina coast (around Wilmington)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC; Tropical Storm Watch areas north of NC/VA border now upgraded and no watches extend into Florida.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning South Santee River SC to Duck NC, including Albemarle and Pamlico Sounds; Tropical Storm Warning north of Duck NC to Cape Charles Light VA and lower Chesapeake Bay.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Primary impacts expected along the North Carolina and northern South Carolina coasts with secondary effects spreading inland across the Carolinas and southern mid-Atlantic.
weather_observation.wind: Low to moderate chance (≤21%) for sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts possible late weekend as Florence’s remnants move inland north of the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; only minor water level rises of 1–2 ft possible along northeast Florida beaches.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could produce 1–3 inches of rain but widespread 4-inch totals are not anticipated.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along northeast Florida beaches through the weekend.
